text:
what’s the best way to manage access tokens for each HubSpot User for the marketplace app?

I am developing Marketplace app to send data for that HubSpot Account only,

Everything is working fine except knowing how to get HubSpot account information to fetch details for that HubSpot account from my cloud database.

Hi <#C2YHAHB6K|api>, I'm a developer at DxFactor, currently I'm working on integrating the HubSpot with our database, which will allow to sync contacts from HubSpot to the database. So far, using HubSpot's API, I could able to fetch all the recently created/modified contacts as per lastmodifiedate property, however it fails to fetch contacts which are deleted and moved to archieved. I needed to fetch those archieved contacts as well  to delete them in my database. I have also tried this api: <https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/contacts?archived=true> , but it fetches all the archieved contacts at a time, which I don't want. My requirement is to fetch archieved contacts according the lastmodifed/archieved date or essentially want to filter out data but doesnt want all the archieved contacts. I would really appreciate any solutions/ workaround. Thank you in advance !!

Hello all,
I have a strange situation that has cropped up on two latest blog articles.  Some of the custom modules are not showing up in the widgets list. The previous articles do show the module in the widgets list, and all other page types for that matter.

Verified against Developer info, the custom module is there but just as module... not in the widget collection.
Using Blog API v3.

Wondering if anyone has a similar experience ?  Thank you
is the display of those widgets limited to a certain number?

No, not as far as I can tell, also I tested just the one recent article,
Then compared using older article which worked...
using online tool and local app.
Same results.  Thanks for your reply.

I haven't gotten it to work. for context I'm using it within a Custom Code action inside a workflow. it works when I do a test call through the api docs link above but on the workflow I'm getting the error `TypeError: Cannot read property 'getById' of undefined`
OKAY
show me your node code to make this call
I feel like HubSpot should put a banner on the api docs “YOU WILL DRIVE YOURSELF CRAZY IF YOU ARE DOING THIS THROUGH A WORKFLOW”

also, I've used another API to fetch hubdb rows `HubSpotClient.cms.hubdb.tables.rowsApi.getTableRows` and this doesn't work either, getting `TypeError: Cannot read property 'rowsApi' of undefined` error. I only got it to work by removing tables and using `HubSpotClient.cms.hubdb.rowsApi.getTableRows` instead
can you post like the
`HubSpotClient.cms.hubdb.tables.rowsApi.getTableRows(item1, item2)
I’m sure you need to reverse them

so what is going on in workflows is that the npm package is an older version — and the only way you can figure out what the actual calls are is by pulling in that node package into a local project and doing the intellisense/hinting that is avaialble in vs code
Do you know what I’m talking about and would understand how to do that?
I see. do you have the link to the node package?
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/workflows/custom-code-actions>
<https://www.npmjs.com/package/@HubSpot/api-client/v/3.4.1>
saved in my favorites
npm i @HubSpot/api-client@3.4.1
thanks, will give it a try!
`npm i @HubSpot/api-client@3.4.1`
so if you do that and then open a local index.js file in that folder, you should be able to copy from your workflow and work thorugh that method
```const objectApiResponse = await HubSpotClient.crm.objects.basicApi.getById(event.object.objectType, event.object.objectId, ['property_name', 'property_address'])```
some of it is just a bit different
I’m going to assume if you are putting valid data in there and know what youa re doing, that this is the issue
I haven't thought of using the custom objects endpoint! I'll try this as well

Hi <@U25PYL3Q8>, thanks for the reply. I'm able to retrieve the data without filters (per form per day) but I don;t know how to add the filters in the call. It returns an error or empty result. Do you know how?

Is it possible to use auth2 in order to federate my front end “case manager” app so that my app’s users can (utilizing tokens) send emails and check stats? So the complete workflow would be:

`Log into case manager tool -> authenticate using oauth2 to HubSpot apis -> make REST transactions directly from case manager tool to HubSpot REST API end points`

I’ve done something similar with our docs site, was just hoping that HubSpot API could do the same so to not have to create an entire backend wrapper suite in order to give our clients access to email campaigns.

when I have issues like this because of a filter or sort problem I usually set up a db table or some similar data structure that I keep track of WHICH archived ones I have already processed. And figure out whats new that way

I’d look in the template to determine if a conneciton issues happened.

I had dev info data still showing on a page, however all the data in the module in the page editor was gone. I realized that in the template, it was pointing to the wrong module — and there was no history of this. It is like the template went back into time.

I reported this to HubSpot

Thanks for the info.  I do believe there is something askew with the template.  But the module is referenced correctly.

It started about the time that HS made major changes 3 weeks ago
yes, this is the same time that ours happened —
I’d report to HubSpot, explain that it is in the developer info
I have a support ticket you can reference 10732569
kool, ok that encourages me. I'll contact them.
Are you able to share like some of your code that you are worign in right now? like send me file or a paste somewhere, etc? so I can take a look at what you have

:wave: Hello, team!

We get an error 500 when trying to create a quotation. */crm/v3/objects/quotes*

The error has no context or description, we need help to understand what property we are sending wrong to correct and create a quote.

The error
```{
  status: 'error',
  message: 'There was an error processing the request.',
  correlationId: 'f3116430-667c-4907-8846-985bfb7cee22',
  category: 'INTERNAL_ERROR'
}```
We send
```{
  properties: {
    hs_status: 'DRAFT',
    hs_title: '10 - Clindamicina ',
    hs_expiration_date: '1665770481',
    hs_language: 'en',
    hs_template_type: 'BASIC',
    HubSpot_owner_id: '119857578'
  }
}```

the error was that we were sending a wrong value for the "hs_template_type" property,
the correct value was CUSTOMIZABLE_QUOTE_TEMPLATE

Hi guys, hope everyone is having a nice day. Maybe someone can help me out:

What is the correct way of adding a contact to HubSpot via API when a new sign up occurs in my SaaS? Is it this one? <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/forms/submit_form>
Why would that 500 error. That seems odd, right?

Plenty of ways to create a contact. The forms api is like a create or update right there! If they are already a contact it will update their data. 

You could also do the create from the contacts api

Hi Everyone I am new here ,
Is there any way to integrate a JSON API from other server to make login/register etc type functionality in HubSpot ?
